department: Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC)
full_summary:
=====================================

### Government Tender Announcement

#### Announcement Title: {title}
Computed Radiography Scanner

#### Reference Number: WS3927134870

#### Publication: April 25, 2023
Deadline to Tender: May 11, 2023, at 2:00 PM EDT

### Tender Overview

The Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC) invites compliant bidders to submit a proposal for the delivery of one (1) Flatbed Computed Radiography Scanner compatible with a Carestream HPX-1 scanner and software.

The requirement is to support field Science and Technology experiments for Defence Research and Development Canada - Suffield Research Centre. This tender does not allow for any substitutes.

### Key Requirements

* The system must operate with large payloads
* Capability redundancies to backup experimentation sites
* Cross compatibility with existing x-ray digital imaging plates is necessary

### Tender Evaluation Criteria

All bids will be evaluated based on price considerations.

### Additional Information

* Please note that only bids submitted before the specified closing time will be considered responsive.
* Attention is drawn to the terms and conditions included in the notice.

### Contact Information

For more information, please contact:

•   Name: Ruwani Wall, SPAC/PSPC
    Email: ruwani.wall@tpsgc-pwgsc.gc.ca
    Address: 400 Cumberland Street,Ottawa,Ontario,K1N 1J8,Canada

### Notice URL

Information about this tender is available at: 
http://discovery.ariba.com/rfx/16096873?extsite=MTYwOTY4NzNfQU4wMTQ4NDA1MDk5Mg==



### Purpose of the Tender

The purpose of the tender is to acquire a drilling tool that meets the current technical specifications in order to optimize and improve drilling operations in the corporation.

 ### Notes 

Note that tender requires the purchase of one unit, for which no substitutes are allowed. We discussed such in the tender evaluation criteria. 






### Document Formats

This archived notice was published by the Government of Canada and is provided as an unofficial electronic version. It has no legal status and should be used only for personal or educational purposes.
